title: Typophage Sans Serif
content:
Hello, here is a sans serif. This font is used for text and display size, combined with an other, serif font (see Critique \> Serif \> Typophage Serif). Details and more in PDF files. ![Typophage Sans Serif v.1.0b](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415024226im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/42495.jpg)

Typophage Sans Serif v.1.0b, PDF
Sans_Serif_v10b.pdf (33.0 k)


Typophage Sans Serif+Serif v.1.0b, PDF
SansSerif+Serif.pdf (30.2 k)
author: Christophe Badani

comments.content:
i'm no pro, so take my advice with a grain or two of salt...   
   
overall i think it's very nice. One feature i really like is that the diagonals in the A, M, V, W, v, w, and y seem to flex or bow just a bit. However the X, Y, Z, x and z seem a bit rigid in contrast, perhaps the k as well.   
   
the eye of the e seems a bit small, as do the eyes of the 6 and the 9. the r looks like an amputated n.   
   
keep up the good work!

This is actually a semi-serif... Good for you - we need those!   
   
It reminds me a little bit of Costa (my fav Porchez font, finally released for retail sale - yay!) but it's certainly original nonetheless. I'm actually liking it a lot - but it needs work. The even tone is nice - it's an honest, but sensitive design. And the stroke terminals are great.   
   
Lowercase:   
- The "a" is obnoxious, sorry. It has the worst of Gill Sans, and that Jannon imbalance to boot.   
- I don't think there's a good reason to give the "f" a descender.   
- The "g" is nice - maybe give the head more size versus the tail - the glyph looks way too small compared to the rest.   
- I think the "k" needs some of the bowing.   
- I'm unsure about the "w".   
- The "x" needs some of the bowing too, and maybe the "z" as well.   
   
The caps are really nice.   
- The "L" and "T" seem too wide.   
- Consider bowing in the "K", "X", "Y" and "Z".   
- The "S" needs more balance and polish.   
   
Others:   
- Interesting numerals. The "3" is too much though.   
- I like the 3rd ampersand. A lot.   
- Superb "at" sign.   
- Flatten the UC accents.   
- The acute and grave seem a hair too strong.   
   
Spacing: it needs work, but with some tightening I think the wordspace you have is good here.   
   
--   
   
One thing about the pairing with the serif version though - I don't see them as compatible designs at all - certainly not sister types.   
   
hhp

\> This is actually a semi-serif...   
   
Well, only the ascenders have serifs. That's 5 characters out of 26.   
   
   
\> It reminds me a little bit of Costa   
   
And it also reminds me of Fedra.   
   
   
\> The "a" is obnoxious, sorry. It has the worst of   
\> Gill Sans, and that Jannon imbalance to boot.   
   
I don't think so. The a is fine to me.   
   
   
\> I don't think there's a good reason to give the "f" a descender.   
   
Me neither. The descender gives too much emphasis to the   
white space between the f and the next letter.   
   
I think the figures are great, maybe except for 6 and 9; they   
need bigger counters.
Christophe, this sans reminds me a bit of Lucas de Groot

Hey Cristophe. Good to see you here.   
   
Like most of your work, it's very nice. The bowing is lovely.   
Something to keep in mind: most folks can't stand the   
disconnected 'Q' in de Groot's Thesis. Make sure you have   
a good reason for yours.
